quote: In this storyI am the poetYou're the poetry.
author: Arzum Uzun

quote: The true poem rests between the words.
author: Vanna Bonta,  Shades Of The World

quote: This poetry. I never know what I'm going to say.
author: Rumi

quote: Poets are shameless with their experiences: they exploit them.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Poetry is just so emo."he said. "Oh, the pain. The pain. It always rains. In my soul.
author: John Green,  Paper Towns

quote: Where are the quotes?
author: Yousef Yousef

quote: Poetry heals the wounds inflicted by reason.
author: Novalis

quote: Poetry is a life-cherishing force.
author: Mary Oliver

quote: Poets utter great and wise things which they do not themselves understand.
author: Plato

quote: A poet should be so crafty with words that he is envied even for his pains.
author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy

quote: One merit of poetry few persons will deny: it says more and in fewer words than prose.
author: Voltaire,  Philosophical Dictionary

quote: If you cannot be a poet, be the poem.
author: David Carradine

quote: If you can not be a poet, be the poem.
author: David Carradine

quote: The poet's job is to put into words those feelings we all have that are so deep, so important, and yet so difficult to name, to tell the truth in such a beautiful way, that people cannot live without it.
author: Jane Kenyon

quote: Inspirational quotes are dances of light that shine in dark places during your life.
author: Shannon L. Alder

quote: Poets and Competitiveness [10w] "I'm the only poet I need to be better than.
author: Beryl Dov

quote: Poets Job Description [10w] Poets console the soul with words and eyes with images.
author: Beryl Dov

quote: Poetry is a life-cherishing force. For poems are not words, after all, but fires for the cold, ropes let down to the lost, something as necessary as bread in the pockets of the hungry.
author: Mary Oliver,  A Poetry Handbook

quote: The Poet's Way Are we ever sure what we do,will endure and get its due?No.But we do it anyway.For that is the poet's way.
author: Beryl Dov

quote: Poetry: the best words in the best order.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: re-examine all you have been told in school or church or in any book, and dismiss whatever insults your own soul; and your very flesh shall be a great poem, and have the richest fluency, not only in its words, but in the silent lines of its lips and face, and between the lashes of your eyes, and in every motion and joint of your body.[From the preface to Leaves Grass]
author: Walt Whitman,  Leaves of Grass

quote: Poetry is a mirror which makes beautiful that which is distorted
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: Poetry is a way of taking life by the throat.
author: Robert Frost

quote: For you, my love, I would endeavor to pluck the stars from the sky, only to shower them at your feet.”“How do you do that?’“Do what?”“Say things like that. That’s beautiful.”“I’ve spent years studying poetry, Mrs. Emerson. It’s in my DNA.
author: Sylvain Reynard,  Gabriel's Redemption

quote: Poetry is a deal of joy and pain and wonder, with a dash of the dictionary.
author: Kahlil Gibran,  Sand and Foam

quote: Poetry is life distilled.
author: Gwendolyn Brooks

quote: Poetry happens when there is nothing to say but you have a volcano hidden inside you waiting to erupt.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Every word was once a poem.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Poetry may make us from time to time a little more aware of the deeper, unnamed feelings which form the substratum of our being, to which we rarely penetrate; for our lives are mostly a constant evasion of ourselves.
author: T.S. Eliot

quote: Beloved Poetry [10w] Write poetry like it’ll convince your beloved who to marry.
author: Beryl Dov

quote: One must read poetry with one's nerves.
author: Wallace Stevens

quote: Poetry is a rich, full-bodied whistle, cracked ice crunching in pails, the night that numbs the leaf, the duel of two nightingales, the sweet pea that has run wild, Creation's tears in shoulder blades.
author: Boris Pasternak

quote: Great Poets [10w] Great poets can milk blood and tears from a stone.
author: Beryl Dov

quote: To elevate the soul, poetry is necessary.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: Poetry is the rhythmical creation of beauty in words.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: Break All the Rules of Poetry Place no limits on your poetry.Live a little.Break all the fucking rules!If it comes deep from the wellsprings of your imagination,the woolgathering of dreamers ~it is poetry ~no matter what anyone says.
author: Beryl Dov

quote: This is perhaps the most noble aim of poetry, to attach ourselves to the world around us, to turn desire into love, to embrace, finally what always evades us, what is beyond, but what is always there – the unspoken, the spirit, the soul.
author: Octavio Paz,  The Other Voice: Essays on Modern Poetry

quote: Poets are damned… but see with the eyes of angels.
author: Allen Ginsberg

quote: She dotes on poetry, sir. She adores it; I may say that her whole soul and mind are wound up, and entwined with it. She has produced some delightful pieces, herself, sir. You may have met with her 'Ode to an Expiring Frog,' sir.
author: Charles Dickens,  The Pickwick Papers

quote: The inmost spirit of poetry, in other words, is at bottom, in every recorded case, the voice of pain – and the physical body, so to speak, of poetry, is the treatment by which the poet tries to reconcile that pain with the world.
author: Ted Hughes

quote: Were you always such a stubborn, blind, obtuse girl?”“Are you calling me stupid?”“Yes, but in a more poetic way!”“Well, here’s a poem for you. Get lost!
author: Colleen Houck

quote: Poetry is the spontaneous overflow of powerful feelings: it takes its origin from emotion recollected in tranquility.
author: William Wordsworth,  Lyrical Ballads

quote: Every poem should remind the reader that they are going to die.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: Some people will tell you there is a great deal of poetry and fine sentiment in a chest of tea.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson,  Letters and Social Aims

quote: Every heart sings a song, incomplete, until another heart whispers back. Those who wish to sing always find a song. At the touch of a lover, everyone becomes a poet.
author: Plato

quote: The day came when she discovered sex, sensuality, and literature; she said, 'I submit! Let my life be henceforth ruled by poetry. Let me reign as the queen of my dreams until I become nothing less than the heroine of God.
author: Roman Payne

quote: Poetry and art nourish the soul of the world with the flavor-filled substances of beauty, wisdom and truth.
author: Aberjhani,  Journey through the Power of the Rainbow: Quotations from a Life Made Out of Poetry

quote: Poetry is eternal graffiti written in the heart of everyone.
author: Lawrence Ferlinghetti,  Americus, Book I

quote: If I'm the people's poet, then I ought to be in people's hands - and, I hope, in their heart.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: A poem begins as a lump in the throat, a sense of wrong, a homesickness, a lovesickness.
author: Robert Frost
